above.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: in a higher position than something else
above.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Our office is above the hairdresser’s.
He had a bruise just above his left eye.
I heard a strange noise coming from the room above.
The great bird hovered high above our heads.
above.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: more than a particular number, amount, or level
above.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The salaries we offer are well above  (=much higher than) average.
Tonight, temperatures should be just above freezing.
free medical care for pensioners aged 65 and above
Prize winners must have gained marks of 80% or above.
above.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to a greater degree than something else
above.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Many employers value personality above experience or qualifications.
medals awarded for bravery above and beyond the call of duty  (=greater than it is your duty to show)
Max is hard-working, cheerful, and above all honest.
above.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: louder or clearer than other sounds
above.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: You can always hear her voice above everybody else’s.
above.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: higher in rank, power, or importance
above.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: He never rose above the rank of corporal.
officers of the rank of Major and above
We just obey orders from above.
above.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: before, in the same piece of writing
above.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: As mentioned above, there is a service charge.
Write to the address above for further information.
above.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: used in a piece of writing to refer to something mentioned in an earlier part of the same piece of writing
above.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: For the above reasons, the management has no choice but to close the factory.
